issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Ability to specify per-file EC policy at create time

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: At startup, the balancer writes its hostname to the lock file and calls hflush(). hflush is not supported for EC files, so this fails when the entire filesystem is erasure coded.
fields.summary: Add shouldReplicate option to create builder

comments.body: Heads up [~Sammi], this relates to our discussion about a "replicated" EC policy. We could use it to force the balancer lock file to be a replicated file.

Hi [~andrew.wang], yea, we need face this a "replicated" EC policy now.  Let me first clear understand the requirements. So to your knowledge, can a file create API which forces use default replication solve all the issues we met so far and all foreseeable issues? Or should we also provide a way to set a "replicated" EC policy on directory? If only a create API is required, I would suggest not introduce the "replicated" EC policy concept, we can add a Boolean parameter to create function to enforce the file to be replication file. If we also need to provide set an directory back to replication, other than inherit its parent's EC policy, then "replicated" EC policy is a must.

Agree, at least for the balancer, I think for now we only need a new boolean parameter like you say.

This also relates to HDFS-11644. If DFSStripedOutputStream no longer implements Syncable, then the Balancer's FSDataOutputStream#hflush will fallback to just doing a flush. For the balancer, I think we'd still prefer writing a replicated file and doing a real hflush, since otherwise {{write2IdFile}} won't function correctly.
Initial patch

This message was automatically generated.

Hi Sammi, took a deeper look at this, mostly just nitty and API stuff:

HdfsDataOutputStreamBuilder:
* We can simplify and rename the setter {{enforceAsReplicatedFile(Boolean)}} to just be {{replicate()}} with no parameters, since the default is false. I think this could also just be a primitive boolean, since the {{dfs.create}} takes a primitive boolean rather than a nullable Boolean.
* asReplicatedFile, recommend we rename to {{shouldReplicate}} and make the getter protected
* We also should add some Javadoc to {{replicateFile}} and {{setEcPolicyName}} to explain what they do and that they are exclusive.

I'd prefer to be more consistent about {{ecPolicyName}} and {{asReplicated}} being exclusive parameters and throwing an exception. We fixed the builder, but a few other places I noticed:
* ClientProtocol: docs say that ecPolicyName is ignored, instead, let's make it clear that it's invalid to set {{asReplicated}} to true and also a non-null {{ecPolicyName}}.
* Builder#build: Please add some additional help text for the user when the Precondition check fires
* FSNamesystem#startFileInt: Let's check exclusivity here as well, can do it outside the write lock where we do the invalid path check.

Tests:
* Note that the DiskBalancer is different from the Balancer. We should be adding a test to TestBalancer instead.

Recommend reformatting these chained calls in TestErasureCodingPolicies like this for clarity:

{noformat}
    fs.newFSDataOutputStreamBuilder(filePath).setEcPolicyName(ecPolicyName)
        .enforceAsReplicatedFile(false).build().close();
{noformat}

{noformat}
    fs.newFSDataOutputStreamBuilder(filePath)
        .setEcPolicyName(ecPolicyName)
        .enforceAsReplicatedFile(false)
        .build()
        .close();
{noformat}
Uploaded a new patch, improved based on Andrew's suggestion.

This message was automatically generated.
Double checked the issues reported by findbugs, asflicense and unit test. It seems all are irrelevant.

Looks pretty close, wanted to clarify a few renames, +1 pending these:

* Recommend rename {{enforceReplicate}} to just {{replicate}}
* Many variables named {{asReplicatedFile}} still, please update these too, maybe {{shouldReplicate}} instead like the getter name? Rename the proto field too.

Really appreciate your work here Sammi!
Upload a new Patch.  Thanks, Andrew!

This message was automatically generated.

HI [~Sammi]
Thanks for working on this patch. I know Andrew has basically +1 the last patch, but I'd like to ask for a second thought:

I think you need to mark this jira as an incompatible change, because the method signature of DFSClient.create() is changed.

I also wonder if it's possible to use CreateFlag, instead of adding a new parameter shouldReplicate for the same purpose. This will also avoid the incompatibility issue, plus, it's really not my taste to have so many parameters. I think it's a good idea to think twice about changing the signature of a public API.

Thanks for reviewing Wei-chiu,

Despite what downstreams may do, DFSClient is a private API, so we're allowed to change it. However, good point about CreateFlag, we definitely should avoid adding new boolean parameters. I missed this during my review. Sammi, could you update the patch? I think this only affects the wire format, let's leave the builder API as-is. I left a comment on HADOOP-14365 about a proposed enhancement for the flags.
Thanks [~jojochuang] & [~andrew.wang] for review the patch!  CreateFlag is a good idea. I will upload a new patch later.
Add SHOULD_REPLICATE CreateFlag to indicate create a replicate file

This message was automatically generated.
Double checked the failed unit test. TestBalancer passed locally. TestStartup and TestMetadataVersionOutput failed with & without the patch applied.

Hi Sammi, I noticed that the 007 patch doesn't include any changes to the balancer to use the new shouldReplicate builder API. The new unit test changes work without the rest of the patch applied because we just committed HDFS-11718 so EC files don't throw an exception on hflush/hsync.

Can we add an assert to check that the balancer's lock file is replicated? Thanks.

Hi [~andrew.wang],  the changes to use the new shouldReplicate builder API is in {{NameNodeConnector}}  class. It enforce the Id lock file to be a replicated file instead of striped file.  So even without the HDFS-11718 commit, the new unit test should work.

Woops, I missed that, thanks Sammi. Still, given that just the TestBalancer change works without the rest of the patch applied, we should do an explicit check that the balancer's lock file is replicated and not EC. New tests should exhibit "fail before, works after" behavior.

I add check that ID lock file should be a replicate file and manually tested "fail before, works after" behavior since such an auto unit test is not feasible given the lock file is enforced to be a replicate file.

This message was automatically generated.
I see the check was added to NameNodeConnector, can it be added to TestBalancer instead, for instance in {{runBalancer}}? I'd prefer that we not add the check to the production code.

My consideration is Id lock file is not only used for {{Balancer}}, but also used for {{Mover}}, might be used for other tool in future,  so add the check in production code is a once-for-all solution.  On the other hand, Id lock file path is an private data of {{Balancer}}, it's not exposed to outside. If put the check in unit test, Id file path will be hard coded. Once the Id file path changed, the unit test will fail.  So I would prefer put the check in production code unless there is severe impact.

Fair enough. We should try revising this once HDFS-11644 goes in, since it offers a clean way of querying the stream's capabilities without the additional RPC. I'll file a follow-on JIRA.

Let's get this in, thanks Sammi! Will commit shortly.

Committed, thanks for the great work here Sammi!

Filed HDFS-11757 as a follow-on for the balancer lock file check, ping [~manojg] as a heads up too.

SUCCESS: Integrated in Jenkins build Hadoop-trunk-Commit #11683 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/11683/])
